item.description:
Learn to identify and enjoy wild foods, including several types of salad greens, a couple of root vegetables, some fruits, and herbal and medicinal teas. 

Focus is on identification of a few plants, so that participants will feel more confident to identify plants on their own. 

We'll walk along the Minuteman Bicycle Trail and some thicketed areas nearby.

Price is $10-$20 sliding scale.

Call 617-492-2340 for more details.

Taught by Jules Kobek , co-founder of DIO (Do-It-Ourselves) Skillshare, which  facilitates workshops on skills of urban sustainability, such as sprouting, growing vegetables, and constructing raised garden beds.  She has been gathering and eating wild edible plants for several years.
item.how_to_find_us: drop-off/ pick-up area of Alewife subway station
item.name: Edible Wild Plants of Thickets and Fields
